name: Scalp Balancing Shampoo
about: What it is:A sulfate-free shampoo with salicylic acid and niacinamide to improve scalp hydration and visibly reduce flakes, oiliness, and itchiness..Hair Texture:Straight, Wavy, Curly, and Coily.Hair Type:Fine, Medium, and Thick.Hair Concerns:- Dryness.Key Benefits:- Hydrates the scalp and soothes discomfort.Highlighted Ingredients:- Argan Oil: Is an antioxidant-rich, natural oil that nourishes the hair and scalp..Ingredient Callouts:Free of sulfates SLS & SLES. It is also cruelty-free..What Else You Need to Know:Gentle yet powerful, this purifying shampoo visibly restores oily, irritated, and dry scalps to a balanced state while providing hair with optimal moisture. Its Botanical Therapy Blend relieves discomfort and protects, promoting the ideal environment for hair growth..Fragrance Description:The Moroccanoil Scalp Collection has a refreshing fragrance crafted from natural oils specially curated for the needs of the scalp. The aromatherapeutic blend of lavender, tea tree, and bergamot awakens the senses for a spa-like experience...Clinical Results:In an independent lab study with consumer and instrumental testing, after 1 use:
ingredients: -Argan Oil: Is an antioxidant-rich, natural oil that nourishes the hair and scalp..-Salicylic Acid: Is a gentle exfoliant that visibly reduces flakes and prevents oil buildup..-Niacinamide (Vitamin B3): Calms scalp irritation and reduces redness...Aqua/Water/Eau, Sodium C14-16 Olefin Sulfonate, Cocamidopropyl Betaine, Cocamide Methyl MEA, Dipropylene Glycol, Lauryl Hydroxysultaine, Tea-Cocoyl Glutamate, Polysorbate 20, Argania Spinosa (Argan) Kernel Oil, Fumaria Officinalis (Fumitory) Extract, Hordeum Distichon (Barley) Extract, Melissa Officinalis (Lemon Balm) Leaf Extract, Prunus Yedoensis (Cherry) Leaf Extract, Swertia Japonica (Semburi) Extract, Menthol, Citric Acid, Dipotassium Glycyrrhizate, Glucosyl Hesperidin, Niacinamide, Ethylhexylglycerin, PEG-160 Sorbitan Triisostearate, Polyquaternium-10, Salicylic Acid, Butylene Glycol, Isopropyl Alcohol, Parfum/Fragrance, Disodium EDTA, Sodium Acetate, Sodium Benzoate, Sodium Citrate, Sodium Dilauramidoglutamide Lysine, Phenoxyethanol, Linalool, Limonene.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Wet hair..-Massage throughout hair and scalp..-Rinse well..-Repeat if needed..-Follow with Moroccanoil Scalp Balancing Conditioner (sold separately).

reviews.review_title: Great, but smells bad! Missing that iconic scent!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, Oily skin
reviews.review_text: The shampoo is satisfactory, but WHY (!!!?) would you change the iconic scent!? One of the selling points of this brand is the amazing perfume used in their products. This smells like some Aveda rosemary imitation. Please, please reconsider the formula solely for the smell. Otherwise, I am thrilled that Moroccan Oil finally has a product line aside from hydration. Keep up the good work, but don't lose your branding in the process.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Light skin tone, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: If you have psoriasis/eczema on scalp please do not use this. this is the worst my scalp has been in years and that is from using this product. Youu2019re better off using a coal tar shampoo.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, brown hair, Medium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Donu2019t fall for these incentivized reviews like I did. I bought this shampoo and after using it it made my scalp 3x more greasy by the next 2 days.
